meanings.definition: The point in the orbit of the moon or a satellite at which it is nearest to the earth.
meanings.sent1: During the perigee, the satellite is closest to the earth.
meanings.sent2: The perigee of the moon is an important astronomical event.
meanings.sent3: At perigee, the moon likes to play hide and seek with the earth.
meanings.sent4: The perigee of the satellite brought it within touching distance of the earth.
meanings.sent5: The perigee is like a close hug between the moon and the earth.

meanings.definition: The closest point to the earth in the orbit of a celestial body.
meanings.sent1: The perigee of the comet was a spectacular sight in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers study the perigee of celestial bodies to understand their orbits.
meanings.sent3: The perigee of the asteroid made it feel like a shooting star passing by.
meanings.sent4: The perigee of the planet seemed to bring it within reach of the earth.
meanings.sent5: Witnessing the perigee is like seeing a celestial high-five between planets.
